reviewText: This set contains the following films:The Westerner (1940), directed by William Wyler and costarring Walter Brennan as Judge Roy Bean.The Pride of the Yankees (1942), directed by Sam Wood and costarring Teresa Wright. Cooper stars as New York Yankee Lou Gehrig.Along Came Jones (1945), directed by Stuart Heisler and costarring Loretta Young and William Demarest. A case of mistaken identity produces a very good comic western tale.Man of the West (1958), directed by Anthony Mann and costarring Julie London. Anthony Mann, director of some of the greatest westerns ever made, directs this story of a man running from his past and specifically his extremely twisted outlaw family.These are all four very good films already on DVD, so I imagine that is the reason for the low price and also the reason that these four films are on four discs instead of two. This is most likely just a repackaging of stock just in time for the holidays, and not a bad idea at that.
summary: A repackaging of four previously released Cooper films

reviewText: It's incredible, but I've had to buy the Gary Cooper Collection to get the real DVD specifications, not even in the dvd box you can get this information.The Westerner (1940)Audio: English Mono, Spanish Mono and French Mono.Subtitles: English, Spanish and French.The Pride of the Yankees (1942)Audio: English Mono, Spanish Mono and French Mono.Subtitles: English, Spanish and French.Special Features: no subtitlesAlong Came Jones (1945)Audio: English MonoSubtitles: Spanish and French.Man of the West (1958)Audio: English Mono, Spanish Mono and French Mono.Subtitles: English and Spanish.By the way, great films, Gary Cooper is my favourite actor.
summary: DVD Specifications of The Gary Cooper Collection
Title: N/A

reviewText: It is simply nice to have the possibility of enjoying a good film with Gary Cooper. So hurrah for this collection. I would suggest Universal to be more careful about languages and subtitles; ALONG CAME JONES has no english subtitles which is not good(there are french subtitles!). To find a better international market these films ought to have more languages - in my case also the italian language (it is to be said that we had superb actors who dubbed extremely well in the past). I love to listen to the english language, of course, but I think that my suggestion is to be kept on Universal's mind.Ernesto Oppicelli - Genoa/Italy
summary: TAKE HEART, YOU CAN ALWAYS ENJOY A FILM WITH GARY COOPER!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The supposition of the other reviewer is correct. This is  a re-packaging of previously available releases. Along Came Jones isn't a classic but its good fun and a rail thin Coop actually shows some acting range from comic to action star. The Westerner is a stone cold classic western of the highest pedigree featuring William Wyler in the Directors chair legendary cameraman Gregg Toland and co-star Walter Brennan. Speaking of classics....The Pride of the Yankees is just that as well and this IS the collectors edition with choice bonus features! Man of the West features a weathered Coop in beautiful widescreen with a delicious Julie London. Its hardly a classic but it looks great and I enjoyed it a lot.You have 4 Gary Cooper films on 4 discs...none of this cramming onto 1 or 2 flipper discs like Universal would or compressing them ....but the best quality versions and did I mention "The Westerner" is  absolutely cracking good looking, nice blacks and crisp focus!!To have all 4 of these in a case the size of a single disc and for a single disc price...is a no brainer 5 star release. My concern was that they would be shoved onto a single or 2 disc package and my relief was that they weren't ...if you are curious about these movies or Gary Cooper...hero to John Wayne, Jimmy Stewart, Clint Eastwood and more ....give this a try!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is Region 1 DVD and there is English audio, but I haven't checked for other languages. The quality of them are just like buying them separately. All movies except Man of the West, are in Full frame format. There are four disks in this collection and there is just one case that holds all disks.All movies included are:Along Came Jones (1945/b&W;/90mins)-Gary Cooper, Loretta Young, William Demarest, Dan Duryea, Frank Sully; Directed by Stuart HeislerMan of the West (1958/color/99mins)-Gary Cooper, Julie London, Lee J. Cobb, Arthur O'Connell, Jack Lord; Directed by Anthony MannThe Pride of the Yankees (1942/b&w;/128mins)-Gary Cooper, Teresa Wright, Walter Brennan, Dan Duryea; Directed by Sam WoodThe Westerner (1940/b&w;/100mins)-Gary Cooper, Walter Brennan, Doris Davenport, Fred Stone; Directed by William WylerThis is a great collection of some of the best Gary Cooper movies and Westerns. I would recommend getting this collection, for the price of these movies individually will be a lot higher.
Title: N/A
